metadata.title: CVE-2017-12562 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - low
metadata.description:
Heap-based Buffer Overflow in the psf_binheader_writef function in common.cin libsndfile through 1.0.28 allows remote attackers to cause a denial ofservice (application crash) or possibly have unspecified other impact.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-12562` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libsndfile1 - 1.0.28-3
sndfile-programs - 1.0.28-3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libsndfile package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.0.28-3').
